item.title: How to Carve Out Land on the Internet for Cheap
item.author: Dave Genu
item.description: %!s(<!-- raw HTML omitted -->)<!-- raw HTML omitted -->Fair warning, this entry is as self-referential as self-referential gets. As of Q1 2020, Verisign reports approximately 367 million registered domain names exist on the internet. This corresponds to a vanishingly small percentage of total usage, with capacity ever-increasing due to new top level domains (TLDs) being minted (see this list for all TLDs). If you want “land” on the internet, a place to hang your coat, you should still act sooner rather than later… especially if you’ve eyed a short name with common words.

item.title: Let's Begin
item.author: Dave Genu
item.description: %!s(<!-- raw HTML omitted -->)<!-- raw HTML omitted -->Today, I’ve chosen to publish something online for the first time in a long time. I don’t necessarily know what that will be, yet. I haven’t been struck with inspiration or taken by a fell mood. Consistency will not be an aspect of this website (both in terms of entry usefulness and entry timeliness). Conciseness will not be an aspect of this website. These are just the idle musings of an American man.
